data.title: Lionel Messi's records, achievements and trophy wins in international football
data.meta_description: Lionel Messi-led Argentina beat Colombia in the final of the 2024 Copa America on Monday. The victory helped Messi win his third international trophy. As Messi and Argentina bask in the glory of the Copa America win, here is a look at Messi's record and achievements in international football in the famous blue and white jersey of Argentina.
data.text:
Superstar footballer Lionel Messi added another feather to his cap as Argentina beat Colombia 1-0 in the final of the 2024 Copa America. It is Messi's second Copa America title with La Albiceleste. Messi has enjoyed a stellar career at international level donning Argentina's famous blue and white jersey. Messi is considered world's and Argentina's greatest ever footballer. For Argentina football fans he is often compared with Diego Maradona. As Messi and Argentina celebrate the 2024 Copa America win, we look at Messi's international career, some of his biggest achievements and records in international football. (Image: AP)

Lionel Messi debuted for Argentina at the age of 18 years 01 month during an international friendly between Argentina and Hungary played on August 17 2005 at the Ferenc-Pusk√°s-Stadion. Argentina beat Hungary 2-1 in the match. Messi scored his first goal for Argentina in 2006 against Croatia. (Image: Reuters)

Lionel Messi is Argentina's most capped footballer and record goal scorer. Messi has played 187 matches for Argentina in which he has netted 109 goals. (Image: AP)

Lionel Messi's 109 goals for Argentina makes him the second-highest goal scorer in the men's international football. Messi is only behind Cristiano Ronaldo. (Image: Reuters)

Lionel Messi boasts of an Olympic gold medal. At the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games Argentina beat Nigeria in the final of the men's football tournament to win the gold medal. Argentina's victory made Messi an Olympic gold medalist. (Image: Reuters)

Lionel Messi won his first international trophy in 2021 when Argentina won that year's Copa America after beating archrivals Brazil in the final. (Image: Reuters)

In 2022, Lionel Messi-led Argentina beat Italy in the Finalissima to lift the coveted Finalissima trophy. Finalissima is the match played between the winner of the Euro or the European Championship and the winner of the Copa America or the South American Championship. In 2021 while Argentina were the winner of the Copa America, Italy won that year's Euro. In the 2022 Finalissima Argentina beat Italy 3-0 as Messi added yet another international trophy to his cabinet. (Image: Reuters)

The greatest moment of Lionel Messi's international career arrived when Argentina beat France in the final of the 2022 FIFA World Cup. It was Argentina's third World Cup win but first World Cup win for Lionel Messi. The World Cup win made Messi surpass his fierce rival Cristiano Ronaldo as the Portuguese doesn't boast of a World Cup trophy. (Image: Reuters)

Lionel Messi has twice won the FIFA World Cup Golden Ball for top scoring in the 2014 edition and the 2022 edition of the FIFA World Cup. (Image: Reuters)
